intro: Heydia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Heydia has small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually alternate and hairy. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
